benchmark_details.name: CP-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: CP-Bench is a novel benchmark that includes a diverse set of well-known combinatorial problems sourced from the CP community, structured explicitly for evaluating LLM-driven constraint modelling.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the capabilities of LLMs in generating constraint models based on natural language descriptions of combinatorial problems.

data.source: Diverse combinatorial problem descriptions gathered from distinct sources within the CP community.

methodology.calculation: The solution accuracy measures the correctness of the solution obtained by executing the generated code.
methodology.interpretation: A generated solution is considered accurate if it satisfies the constraints of the ground-truth model.
methodology.baseline_results: Results show higher performance models achieving up to 70% accuracy across diverse combinatorial problems.
methodology.validation: Systematic evaluation of state-of-the-art LLMs using the CP-Bench dataset.
